speakers.name: Function Calling with the Vertex AI Gemini API
speakers.info:
We will explore Google Cloud Platform - Vertex AI powered experiences, we are going to learn more about the integration of these generative AI APIs by developers to build and deploy AI-driven applications. Gemini is a family of generative AI models developed by Google DeepMind that is designed for multimodal use cases available for companies via Vertex AI.

Function calling lets developers create a description of a function in their code, then pass that description to a language model in a request. The response from the model includes the name of a function that matches the description and the arguments to call it with. In this session, you will learn how to use the Vertex AI Gemini API with the Vertex AI SDK for Python to make function calls via the Gemini Pro (gemini-pro) model.

We are going to cover the following interaction with the Gemini Pro model:

- Generate function calls from a text prompt to get the weather for a given location
- Generate function calls from a text prompt and call an external API to geocode addresses
- Generate function calls from a chat prompt to help retail users

At the end of the session, developers will understand how to innovate with generative AI and develop apps using the generative ai industry trends.

speakers.name: Inference with LLMs on Cloud Run serverless GPU
speakers.info: Modern Machine Learning Ops always relied on Kubernetes together with a framework with Kubeflow or MLFLow to be able to provision GPUs for inference or training on nodes. With Cloud Run GPUs, I will demo how to set up via terraform an LLM inference and training environment for use and go through cost calculations for different usage scenarios.

speakers.name: Unleashing the Power of Chrome devtools for Web Accessibility Testing
speakers.info:
When it comes to testing for accessibility of our web apps, most of us would have used Chrome Lighthouse to generate a report and use the results to improve the accessibility of our web apps. However, that is not the only way to test for accessibility, and those tests can only detect a subset of issues. Do you know, there are many other ways in which we can test for accessibility using those same dev tools?

In this talk, we will delve beyond the conventional use of Chrome Lighthouse and uncover several alternative methods within the developer tools to test web accessibility. We will explore techniques such as inspecting the accessibility tree, gaining insights into ARIA attributes, emulating various vision disabilities, and more.

So, join me in this session, where we will unlock the potential of dev tools to unveil a diverse range of accessibility issues. Let's all learn together and improve how we test for web accessibility, and make the web inclusive for all our users.

speakers.speakerInfo: Solutions Architect at Online Partner AB
speakers.name: Understand how to use and reuse GCP's Cloud Foundation Fabric templates for quick and replicable deployments
speakers.info:
Cloud Foundation Fabric (https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/cloud-foundation-fabric) is a set of Terraform templates provided by GCP to facilitate the deployment and re-deployment of GCP resources quickly and in a standardized manner.

In this session, we will take a look at some of these templates, look into how they work, and deploy a couple of them in a demo environment.

speakers.name: Flutter with Gemini, AI in your hand
speakers.info: Have you heard of Flutter? The cross-platform framework developed by Google, with which you can deploy your applications on all platforms from the same code. But what about AI, right? We will also meet Gemini, Google's most advanced LLM, and how we can connect it to our Flutter applications in a very, very simple way. After this talk you will have no excuse to develop your next app.

speakers.speakerInfo: Staff Data Engineer at Admiral Group
speakers.name: Unleashing the Power of Gemma: From Cloud to Edge
speakers.info:
Gemma, Google‚Äôs new family of lightweight, state-of-the-art open models. Built on the same research and technology as the groundbreaking Gemini models, Gemma empowers developers to create innovative applications across various platforms. We‚Äôll cover the types of models available and how to customize them to tune for new tasks.

This session will explore the multifaceted capabilities of Gemma models, providing practical insights, demos, and code demonstrations for:

Kaggle: Building engaging chat applications using the Keras API and the Kaggle Model Hub.

Hugging Face: Leveraging the open collaboration between Google and Hugging Face for seamless integration and deployment.

Mobile: Experimenting with Gemma on-device using MediaPipe and TensorFlow Lite for cross-platform compatibility.

Local Machines: Running Gemma efficiently on laptops with Llama.cpp and quantized models.

Vertex AI: Streamlining AI development and deployment with Vertex AI‚Äôs comprehensive platform.

Whether you‚Äôre a seasoned AI developer or just starting, this session will equip you with the knowledge and tools to harness the full potential of Gemma models. The session will conclude with a series of live demos showcasing the practical applications of these technologies.

speakers.name: Back to the future with WebAssembly
speakers.info:
WebAssembly has been The Future of Programming‚Ñ¢Ô∏è for quite some time now, but now that it's finally looking usable - is it worth the hype? Should I even care? Will it take my job?
If you want to know the answer to these questions (yes, yes and maybe), join me for a deep dive into the world of WebAssembly and let's learn how to use this technology of the future, today.

speakers.name: Exploring Kotlin Symbol Processing
speakers.info:
In this session we‚Äôll dive into the world of Kotlin Symbol Processing (KSP). This session aims to provide an introduction to KSP and its benefits compared to the Kotlin Annotation Processing Tool (KAPT).

The practical portion of this talk will guide you through the process of creating annotation definitions and implementing a symbol processor. We will demonstrate the usage of KSP API and KotlinPoet for generating Kotlin files, providing you with a hands-on experience of working with KSP. Furthermore, we will demonstrate how to use KSP in multiplatform projects.

By the end of this talk, you will walk away with a solid understanding of Kotlin Symbol Processing, and practical knowledge on how to leverage KSP in your development workflow.

speakers.name: Going Serverless with Dart
speakers.info: You will learn how to write and deploy Dart logic in a serverless fashion using AWS and GCP.

speakers.name: Become a Full Full-stack Developer
speakers.info: It's not a typo. You heard about Full-Stack developers, but what about Full "Full-Stack developers" using power of Flutter and Dart. I'll cover how can Flutter and Dart work on many different platforms. So you can be like a one-man army, building apps for iOS, Android, Web, desktops, embedded and server.

speakers.name: Golang - from Google's experiment to polyvalent enterprise programming platform
speakers.info:
This talk will aggregate rapid advancement of Golang in a little bit more than 10 years, highlighting not only unquestionable technical prowess but also many other governing aspects that made Golang first class citizen among high level programming languages.

Having hands on demonstration, the idea is to show all the possibilities that Golang offers not only within the originally intended scope of work where Golang naturally excels, such as web services and similar applications, but covering full spread of various system applications, ranging from fully fledged one-binary root file system (initramfs) containing a busybox-like set of tools, following utilization of Golang as a plane for deploying system level application atop of the Linux kernel, all the way to shell and scripting environment with advanced features designed for usability, safety and productivity and deploying terminal user interfaces along with advanced Level 3 networking implementations such as BGP.

Finally, a demonstration is to be made on an open source hardware showcasing full spread of Golang utilization.

speakers.speakerInfo: Senior software engineer at mStart d.o.o.
speakers.name: Programming == wilderness survival
speakers.info: Programming and wilderness survival, sound like two completely different terms or maybe not? A travel story about 6 months journey to the Western Sahara passing more than 5000 km by foot, car and bus. Living in nature and visiting the Sahrawi tribe taught me many skills that are very useful in application development. In this presentation we will discover why is a software development a lot like survival in the wild.

speakers.name: AI ruined my code: My journey with ChatGPT
speakers.info:
Are we at one of the biggest inflection points in human history, given the disruption that Generative AI is creating? But what is Generative AI and why is it impacting the world in increasingly significant ways? I, the co-author of the book ‚ÄúGenerative AI for Web Development: Building Web Applications Powered by OpenAI APIs and Next.js‚Äù soon to be published by Apress, will share with you what I learned about GenAI by writing a book about it.

In my talk, I will present, through practical examples, the pros and cons of the latest prompting techniques for generating code to build web apps, powered by OpenAI‚Äôs ChatGPT including:

Generating web apps with Next.js (Building a Language Learning App)
The legal and security issues you should be aware of including deploying or integrating web applications, sending sensitive data and copyright laws for commercial purposes
Actionable strategies like best practices and tips to get around the limitations of ChatGPT

Depending on the session length, I will either keep it high-level or give hands-on experience with the technology.

speakers.speakerInfo: Software Engineer at Very Good Ventures
speakers.name: To be announced
speakers.info: Details coming soon ü§û

speakers.name: Ray on Vertex AI
speakers.info:
What is Ray?

A multiprocessing tool for large-scale training pipelines or even normal Python code. We review the details of what Ray is, and how to use it. And the similarities between Ray and Spark.

speakers.name: FinOps: A New Hope
speakers.info:
Migration to the cloud has changed the way infrastructure resources are consumed, forcing businesses to adopt a more flexible but sometimes uncertain consumption model.

In fact, the bill at the end of the month is never the same since you only pay for what you have consumed!

Don't panic, this presentation is here to introduce you to FinOps practices which offer an effective solution for managing this new mode of consumption and optimizing value creation in a Google Cloud environment.

speakers.name: Building Powerful AI Agents using Vertex AI Agent Builder
speakers.info: In this session, you will learn how to build your own production ready Gen AI Agents for your website or business using Google's latest Vertex AI Agent Builder. The session also covers step by step instructions on how to get started and show a real life demo of the implementation from start to finish. At the end of the session, you will be able to build your own GenAI chatbots/voicebots or AI agents and integrate with your website.

speakers.name: Angular's Renaissance: Exploring the Latest Gems
speakers.info: Unlock the power of Angular with an in-depth exploration of its latest features and improvements. Discover how these groundbreaking features empower you to build exceptional web applications with speed, efficiency, and unparalleled user experience, ensuring your applications remain at the forefront of innovation.

speakers.name: A closer look at the blur effect in Flutter
speakers.info:
You're working on a Flutter app when you notice it's getting slow when you start blurring some widgets, but this doesn't happen to all other widgets. You start to wonder: When do these blurs actually slow things down? How do you replicate the nice blurs from Figma in your app? And what's really happening when you use blur that makes it so slow?
Join us as we dig deeper into how blur works, what types of blur Flutter offers, and how we can create our own.

speakers.name: Design Patterns toolbox: (not so) obvious patterns for app development
speakers.info: Tired of the same old design patterns? This talk will introduce you to lesser-known but incredibly powerful techniques that can make your app development life easier. We'll explore multiple OOP design patterns, and show you how they can be used to create better, more flexible apps.

speakers.name: Learn data engineering -- by "stealing" government data
speakers.info:
During this hands-on session listeners will get a feel of what a data engineers work looks like by building a complete data pipeline using government data.

We'll use the Croatian cadastre, an open dataset of land ownership to guide us through the four stages of the data lifecycle: ingestion, storage, processing and visualization.

By the end of the session, listeners will learn how to:
1) Automate downloading the public dataset
2) Store data into BigQuery
3) Clean up and process large datasets in BigQuery
4) Visualize the data in an interactive dashboard using Looker Studio.

Finally, these four steps will be connected into a data pipeline orchestrated using Apache Airflow on Cloud Composer.
